intro: Colea asperrima, commonly known as the rough colea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is notable for its rough, hairy texture, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Due to its unique appearance and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
